column4: guys, any idea what killed my wireless? I ran an update, it stopped working. I tried rolling back to the old madwifi drivers, nothing. the card works in windows so I think it si a config issue. Can I just totally take my wireless settings back to square one?
what were you using to make it work before?
I was using the madwifi drivers... it pretty much just worked.
I am about at my wits end here...
any suggestions?
sorry was away for a bit - I have not used madwifi, ever, so I wouldn't know. Try do a $sudo ifdown <your-interface> , and then an ifup, if you haven't already
done.
any suggestion on how to blow it all out?
apt-get remove <name-of-module> ?
and then an install, again..
did in synaptics actually
that's okay, in Synaptic, right click and remove the package, with all the files taht go with it, then
then try installing it again....
if the module has an associated service, try restarting it first...
yeah, i did that. I may try restarting again though, I hadn't thought of a module problem
I just realized the time, i need to get going. i appreciate the suggestion on the module
like /etc/init.d/<module-name> stop (and then start)
thanks for that suggestion... I just want it to work becauswe I have no idea why it stopped.
looking in /etc/init.d/ will tell you if there is a module...
I know the feeling :| good luck
thanks
